newsitem.title: UK: OPEC members say April output up at 25.61 mbpd.
newsitem.headline: OPEC members say April output up at 25.61 mbpd.

text.p: OPEC pumped 25.61 million barrels per day (bpd) of crude in April, up from 25.46 million bpd in March, according to member country submissions, OPEC headquarters said on Thursday.
OPEC supply to the market in April was 25.65 million bpd, up from 25.35 million bpd, OPEC news agency said in a monthly report from the group's Vienna secretariat.
By comparison a Reuters survey, one of four used by OPEC to monitor its members' production trends, put April output at 27.05 million bpd from 26.85 million bpd in March.
The 11-member group has a combined official ceiling of 25.03 million bpd.
The OPEC secretariat said it had revised down its estimate for 1997 world oil demand by 20,000 bpd to 70.84 million bpd.

It revised up its projection for the call on OPEC crude this year by 100,000 bpd to 25.40 million bpd after an identical downward revision to its estimate of non-OPEC crude and natural gas liquids supply.
Production and supply data for April according to member country submissions so far was as follows:
